entry.title: Organising a Carbon-wise Event
entry.summary: The handbook “Organising a Carbon-wise Event” is a result of the “Carbon-wise Jukola” project. It is an excellent guide to the planning and management of a sustainable orienteering event, and is available here. Click here to go to the page with the handbook. The reader will find in the book a wealth of information and […]

entry.title: Mac Tíre Award
entry.summary: Nominations for the Orienteering Ireland Mac Tire award are invited from our membership and clubs. This awarded to an OI member for their work in developing our sport. entry.summary: We’ve kicked off the year with a bang with Oceania and a great set of sprints in Taranaki and Auckland. entry.title: Call for Nationals relay teams and last entries | 29 March – 1 April 2024
entry.summary: RELAY TEAMS for nationals are to be submitted by Sunday 31 March. Participants without a team will still be able to run in the relay, we will make composite teams from individuals submitted early on the morning of the relay.Last entries accepted by Sunday 10 March 2024. entry.title: Register for orienteering in the 2024 Zespri AIMS Games
entry.summary: This year, for the first time orienteering is included in the Aims Games. The Zespri AIMS Games is Australasia’s largest junior sporting event, held annually in Tauranga Moana. Since its inception in 2004, the Zespri AIMS Games have grown from 760 competitors representing 17 schools and four sporting codes, to the 2023 tournament which welcomed 11,733 competitors, representing 373 schools […] Register for orienteering in the 2024 Zespri AIMS Games first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: World Masters | Bulletin published & congress announced
entry.summary: From 8th to 15th August 2025 Girona awaits master orienteers. In the days before the WMOC there will also be a Congress on Orienteering where we will discuss different aspects of the present and future of our sport. An unique opportunity to share experiences and learn about ideas and ways of working in other countries. […] World Masters | Bulletin published & congress announced first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Auckland Orienteering Club’s structure innovation
entry.summary: There is evidence of significant changes in some clubs in the past year, and Auckland is an example of a club that has been accomplishing big gains as they work on encouraging wider involvement of club members in their club operations. To find out what has been happening we asked club president Neill McGowan to tell […] Auckland Orienteering Club’s structure innovation first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Steve & Vicky Rees-Jones | Runners with a growing ‘O’ addiction!
entry.summary: Did you know we have some keen new orienteers who specialise in running and sports medicine? entry.title: ONZ paying referral prize to recruit new Event Liaison Officer
entry.summary: In our last Compass Point we noted that our current Event Liaison Officer was departing ONZ and that we were looking for someone to fill his shoes. The role requires a technical knowledge of orienteering events as well as the ability to oversee and problem-solve database challenges. The role averages around 7 hours a week and […] ONZ paying referral prize to recruit new Event Liaison Officer first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: In memoriam|Pamela Morrison
entry.summary: On Thursday 15th February 2024 the New Zealand Orienteering community sadly lost a valued member. Pamela Morrison passed away peacefully surrounded by loved ones in beautiful Hawke’s Bay. Pamela has been part of the New Zealand orienteering community for 30+ years, devoting an immense amount of time to the sport. entry.title: SkiO World Cup: Baklid takes the crown again, Olsson claims first overall women’s title
entry.summary: Another fantastic SkiO season for the Norwegian Jørgen Baklid! He finishes at the top again, retaining the men’s World Cup title for the second year in succession. Magdalena Olsson, Sweden came back to take the women’s title after missing the 2023 season. Both won by good margins. Magdalena Olsson ahead of Elin Schagerström (both SWE) […]

entry.title: World Cup 1 & 2 Expressions of Interest due 10 March
entry.summary: Selections will be based on all known form as waiting until the NZO Sprint race on 29th March does not allow people sufficient time to book and make travel arrangements. World Cup No.1 The first round of the 2024 World Cup will be held in Olten, Switzerland on 24th-26th May 2024, and will consist of a Knock-out Sprint […] World Cup 1 & 2 Expressions of Interest due 10 March first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: SkiO World Cup: overall wins for Olsson and Baklid – but second place for both today
entry.summary: Magdalena Olsson, Sweden and Jørgen Baklid, Norway are the 2024 SkiO World Cup champions, both finishing in second place today, Baklid just 1 second behind Eevert Toivonen, Finland. Home athlete Daisy Kudre Schnyder won the women’s race. Ella Turesson, Sweden was an early leader in the women’s race over 8.8 km, held on a mild, […]

entry.title: SkiO World Cup Final Pursuit: second victory for Ekström
entry.summary: Niklas Ekström, Finland kept his cool throughout the 3-loop Pursuit today to win by 52 seconds, whilst in the women’s race it was victory for Norwegian Anna Ulvensøen by just 8 seconds. Ekström and Ulvensøen are both second in the World Cup standings and have narrowed the gap to the leaders today, with Ekström now […]

entry.title: Traubaite and Ekström took their first SkiO World Cup wins in Estonia

entry.title: Orienteering Ireland’s Sprint Training Camp in Dublin: A Weekend Uniting Nations
entry.summary: Orienteering Ireland’s recent Sprint Training Camp in Dublin transcended borders, bringing together participants from the Belgian National Team, the Irish Senior Team, and talented Irish Juniors. This unique blend of international and local talent added an extra layer of excitement to an already thrilling weekend of skill development and competition.
